content: Some psychedelic experiences show remarkable specificity and convergence across different individuals, suggesting the existence of archetypal universals.
The specificity and convergence of psychedelic experiences raise ontological questions, implying that the contents of mystical experience might be objectively real.
Mystical experiences may offer a 'hyper-real' mode of knowing, a direct acquaintance with truth that exists alongside knowledge gained through scientific experimentation.
The deeper lesson from psychedelic experiences may be epistemic, suggesting that a 'hyper-real' mode of knowing can inspire groundbreaking new science.
